instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2641 No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message:
Board does not boot and LED 1 only blink.

pp12V_G3h - 12V
pp12V_s5 = 12v
pp3v42 - 3.41 
pp5v_s5 = 4.9
pp3v3_s5 = 0
PM_EN_P3V3_S5_REG = 3.8v constant.

Tried replacing u7700 - same, but i replaced with ISL62383C same outcome.

i removed R7776  to cut pp3v3_s5 from load, i get still get 3.3 for split second.

threads.title: 820-2641 No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message:
Post basic voltages for U7700; pins 17, 18, 4, 5, 12.
Change it with normal ISL62383, not with "C" suffix.

threads.title: 820-2641 No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message:
3V3_S5 should appear.
If not, check all related resistors and traces; pay atention to R7710 and C7714.
Also check diode mode to ground at L7710.
Be sure to use correct ISL62383 version.

threads.title: 820-2641 No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message: i have replaced with ILS62383 version and i still get the same spike in the beginning and no voltage after that.

threads.title: 820-2641 No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message: Check all traces, solders and components around ISL62383 chip.

threads.title: 820-2641 No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message:
have double checked and triple checked, replaced another ISL62383 for good measure and still get the same results.
removed all resisters connected to the ISL and measured them individually, 

this should be a closed circuit. this is gonna keep me awake for days trying to solve

threads.title: 820-2641 No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message: Post actual voltage for U7700; pins 17, 4, 5, 18, 12.

threads.title: 820-2641 No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message:
So U7700 has correct power and enable.
Did you check C7756 and traces?

threads.title: 820-2641 No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message:
Yes i have checked on p5vs3 lines as well and they are all within spec. i have injected 3.3v to pp3v3_s5 as well as 5v to pp5v_3 and both don't show shorts and have current draw less than 100ma 
the only thing have not looked at is Q7110. measurements all looks good, gonna order some parts and try to replace then

threads.title: 820-2641 No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message:
so, i replaced all the resisters for the ISL(R7720,7721,7724,7790,7791) and Q7110 and still get the same results. pp3v3_s5 just blinks once and dead. Measured Pgood(pin8) never had any output which means ISL is in protection mode. but no idea what protection.

for good measure i injected 3.3v on pin 24 and i get a nice 5v out for pp5v_s3. so the ISL chip is good.
i spent too much time on this board. any last ideas before i throw in the towel?

threads.title: 820-2641 No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message: If you force enable signal for 3V3_S5, does it stay on too?

threads.title: 820-2641 No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message: En signal for 3v3_s5 is already high @3.8v

threads.title: 820-2641 No Boot LED 1 Blinks
threads.message: Remove R7775 and check if get steady 3.3V at C7761.
